text:
Why can't I reach the parameters sent to this module, like module_id ?
When using {{module.menu_id}} its blank. Any guidelines on this?

```{% module "module_16687763962402" path="/fard-theme/modules/FBT-Menu", label="FBT-Menu-extra", menu_id="56491323352", no_wrapper=True  %}```
do you have a field called "menu_id" on your module?
Thanks <@UV23JHEJY>.. So I have to add the field even though I call i manually?

Even with the field ( made in custom module editor ) the field still can not be set in header.html with static value.
Any suggestions. Am I allowed to do it this way at all?
Can you send a screenshot of the module fields/content? one problem I see from this screenshot is that both modules have the same id
what's inside module.html? it should work now from what I can see (just make sure to change id of one of those modules or you'll have the same module instance twice)
The content of module works, as long as I set the default value. But it does not read the menu_id parameter I send.
Does not respond when sending menu_id parameter from header.html

Have you changed something in the global partial content? If you changed something and then modify a module/global partial, changes won't be reflected, you could try resetting to default content on that global partial
Sorry to seem so "blank", but how to i reset to default?
And thanks a lot for the help!
When you're inside the global partial in HubSpot, click "Edit global content", then in the top left corner you'll find revision history, just restore the first version of the global partial
